Horacio is a plant pathologist, nematologist, and applied statistician committed to improving and better protecting soybean health. His research is driven by the intertwined goals of ensuring food stability and helping growers manage diseases that affect yield. Ultimately, he would like to develop integrated plant health strategies by uncovering novel insights into the interactions, ecophysiology, and population biology of soybean pathogens.

## Education

The Ohio State University | Columbus, OH | 
Ph.D. in Plant Pathology

The Ohio State University | Columbus, OH | 
Master of Applied Statistics (M.A.S.)

University of Illinois | Urbana-Champaign, IL | 
M.S. Crop Sciences 

Universidad Nacional de Asunción | Paraguay | 
Agronomía

Adjunct Professor | Universidad de Caldas | 
Manizales, Colombia | Aug 2018 - present
